item.title: 'What's happening?' - Carse causes confusion as he's promoted up the order
item.description: England cause confusion as Brydon Carse makes his way to the crease to bat at number three on day two of the fourth Ashes Test in Melbourne.

item.title: 'The noise is extraordinary' - Duckett ramps for six
item.description: Ben Duckett goes on the attack, ramping Michael Neser for six over as England start aggressively in their pursuit of 175 runs to win the fourth Ashes Test on day two in Melbourne.

item.title: Extra ball allows Carse to remove Neser and Starc in same over
item.description: Brydon Carse takes two wickets in three deliveries, as Michael Neser and Mitchell Starc are both dismissed for a duck to leave Australia 121-9 on day two of the fourth Ashes Test in Melbourne.

item.title: One general, one mathematician: The men competing for power in two African elections
item.description: The leaders of Guinea and the Central African Republic aim to consolidate power after Sunday's polls.

item.title: UK to offer military 'gap year' to boost recruitment
item.description: The paid 12-month course is aimed at under-25s, with plans for the scheme to grow to 1,000 young people a year.

item.title: Zelensky plans to meet Trump on Sunday for talks on ending Russian war
item.description: The Ukrainian president says he will see his US counterpart in Florida, as Kyiv's mayor says Russia launched new air strikes on the capital.

item.title: 'Big wicket!' - Carse bowls Head for 46
item.description: Travis Head gets a higher pitched Brydon Carse delivery wrong as the Australian batter is bowled for 46 runs to leave his side 82-4, with a lead of 124, on day two of the fourth Ashes Test in Melbourne.

item.title: Seamer Atkinson adds to England injury worries
item.description: Seamer Gus Atkinson adds to England’s injury problems by leaving the field on the second morning of the fourth Ashes Test against Australia.

item.title: 'We suffered together' - Amorim changes style as Man Utd win
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim was rewarded for a change in style and formation with a hard-fought win over Newcastle in the Premier League.

item.title: Thousands of US flights disrupted as winter storm looms
item.description: Up to nine inches (23cm) of snow was expected across the New York region during one of the busiest travel weekends of the year.

item.title: Both of these influencers are successful - but only one is human
item.description: Some say AI is ruining social media, but others see its potential to democratise who gains fame online.

item.title: From a dino superhighway to origins of fire-making: The incredible discoveries in 2025
item.description: From ancient footprints to planet parades, 2025 science amazed us with discoveries on Earth and beyond.

item.title: The Papers: 'Royal trips to woo Trump' and 'Gap year soldiers'
item.description: Apparent plans for a royal visit to the US in the new year and a new Army recruitment scheme lead Saturday's papers.

item.title: Five of Queen Elizabeth II's most iconic outfits - from new royal exhibit
item.description: From fashion diplomacy in the US to a transparent raincoat, the late Queen's style was a powerful formula.

item.title: Don't rule out EU customs union, TUC boss tells Starmer
item.description: Trade unionist Paul Nowak says he wants to see the "closest possible" economic relationship with the EU.

item.title: Is texting behind the wheel of a self-driving Tesla crazy?
item.description: Elon Musk says Tesla's automated software will allow its passengers to text in certain conditions.

item.title: Two words to avoid when making your New Year's resolution
item.description: Habit stacking and the language to avoid - five ways to make realistic resolutions you stick to this year.

item.title: 'We will vote but not with our hearts': Inside the election staged by Myanmar's military rulers
item.description: This is the first election since the army's coup in early 2021 - and it is being widely condemned as a sham.

item.title: Quiz of the Year 2025, Part 3: What Instagram caption did Taylor Swift use to announce her engagement?
item.description: Test your memory of 2025 in the third part of our quiz. What happened from July to September?

item.title: Beyoncé, Labubu and Sydney Sweeney's jeans: 15 viral moments that defined 2025
item.description: Dubai chocolate, Adolescence and the parodied Jet2 advert were some of the other most talked about moments.

item.title: British-Egyptian activist arrives in UK after travel ban lifted
item.description: For Alaa Abdel Fattah and his family this is a new beginning after years of separation and suffering.

item.title: Her husband's kidnapping became Malaysia's biggest mystery. Then came a stunning confession
item.description: Nine years after her husband disappeared, Susanna Liew had a stunning legal win in one of Malaysia's biggest mysteries.

item.title: Peta beogradska obeležava 120. godišnjicu, ali na Filološkom fakultetu
item.description: Svečano obeležavanje 120. godina od osnivanja Prve ženske realne gimnazije, kasnije Pete beogradske gimnazije, održaće se van zgrade ove čuvene gimnazije čiji su učenici donedavno
